item.title: Tree on public pathway needs cutting., 19th June
item.description:
This tree is just outside mine and my neighbour’s gardens, just before the electricity sub-station on the pathway from Bicks Lane, Winchcombe. It needs cutting back as is blocking entry through the gate to my back garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bicks Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs obscuring visibility for right turn traffic; inexplicable road narrowing implemented, 19th June
item.description:
It is at the corner of Hyde Lane and Brockhampton Lane, near to the entrance to GE aviation. The signs are right on the junction. This coincides with the narrowing of the road with cones, for a reason which is not at all obvious as no work is taking place, aside from the extensive works in all the surrounding roads. The latest signs make it impossible to see out to the left when turning right out of Brockhampton Lane, where I live. This has already become more difficult as Hyde Lane is loaded with extra traffic given the closure of the A435. It is not safe to pull out to the right.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Potholes and road damage old Reddings road, 19th June
item.description:
There are a number of potholes (deepest pictured)and /road surface damage along old Reddings road, particularly outside our house (Domus). On one section the road surface is coming off. These have been present and getting worse over the last year or so. There is a nursery at the end of the road so it’s a higher volume area than one might expect.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes left by water main leak, 19th June
item.description:
A couple of months back a water main burst outside the gates of UCAS. This caused a number of pot holes in the road. For some reason the company who repaired the leak only repaired the main pot hole caused, not all of the other smaller holes. Severn Trent should be held responsible for fixing all of the pot holes their leak caused, rather than leaving a load in the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Barn Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 22080258 update, 19th June
item.description:
Thank you. The drains do get cleaned and the road gets swept regularly. There is an underground blockage between two of the drains. Sweeping the road makes no difference. Please ask for an underground inspection this problem is years old
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
